q4k.description: Recommended: Fast inference with good quality, ~2.5GB

errors.desktopRequired: This feature requires the desktop app. Please download WaveSpeed Desktop or try the online version.

tips.intelMacUnsupported: Local Z-Image is only supported on Apple Silicon Macs.
tips.linuxArmUnsupported: Linux ARM is not supported for local Z-Image.
tips.windowsArmUnsupported: Windows ARM is not supported for local Z-Image.
tips.linuxCpuOnly: Local Z-Image runs on CPU only on Linux. It may be slow—reduce steps or image size.
tips.windowsVulkanRequired: Local Z-Image on Windows requires Vulkan-capable GPU drivers. If unavailable, generation will be slow or may fail.
tips.slowWithoutMetal: Metal acceleration is not available. Generation will run on CPU and may be slow—reduce steps or image size.

welcome.title: Welcome to Workflow
welcome.desc: Workflow is a visual AI pipeline editor. Drag nodes onto the canvas, connect them, and run automated AI processing flows — from image generation to video enhancement and beyond.

nodePaletteBtn.title: Node Palette
nodePaletteBtn.desc: Click this button to open the Node Palette — your toolbox of all available nodes. You can also search, drag, or click to add nodes to the canvas.

nodePalette.title: Node Categories
nodePalette.desc:
Nodes are organized by category:
• Input — Upload files or enter text as starting data
• AI Task — Run any WaveSpeed AI model (see next step)
• Free Tools — 12 built-in tools like background removal, face enhancement, format conversion
• Output — Preview results or export files to disk

Drag a node to the canvas or click to add it.

aiTask.title: AI Task Node — The Core
aiTask.desc: The AI Task node is the most powerful node in Workflow. It can run any WaveSpeed AI model for image generation, video creation, style transfer, and more.

features.modelSwitch: Choose from hundreds of AI models — the parameter panel updates dynamically based on the selected model
features.dynamicParams: Each model has its own parameters (prompt, image size, seed, etc.) that appear automatically when selected
features.costEstimate: Real-time cost estimation per execution, so you always know the price before running
features.upstream: Connect upstream node outputs (images, text) as inputs — build multi-step AI pipelines

canvas.title: Canvas Interactions
canvas.desc:
The central canvas is your workspace:
• Drag nodes from the palette to position them
• Drag from output ports to input ports to create connections
• Right-click for context menu (copy, paste, delete)
• Scroll to zoom, drag background to pan
• Shortcuts: Ctrl+Z undo, Ctrl+C/V copy-paste, Delete to remove

canvasTools.title: Canvas Tools
canvasTools.desc:
Three handy tools for navigating and organizing your canvas:
• Select / Hand mode — toggle between selecting nodes (V) and panning the canvas (H)
• Fit View — auto-zoom to fit all nodes in the viewport
• Auto Layout — automatically arrange nodes in a clean, readable layout

config.title: Configure & View Results
config.desc:
Click any node to select it. The right panel shows two tabs:
• Config — Set model parameters, upload files, enter prompts
• Results — View execution outputs (images, videos, 3D models)

Parameters update dynamically based on the node type and selected model. Results support fullscreen preview and download.

run.title: Run Your Workflow
run.desc:
Click "Run Workflow" to execute the entire pipeline:
• Set a run count (×1 to ×99) for batch processing
• Cancel anytime with the stop button
• Monitor real-time progress in the Execution Monitor
• Each node shows its status: queued → running → done

templates.title: Templates, Import & Export
templates.desc:
Click the ⋮ menu for advanced features:
• Save your workflow as a reusable template
• Import/Export workflows as JSON to share
• Open multiple workflows in tabs (like a browser)
• Browse pre-built templates from the toolbar
